docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Setting up blog in Material for Mkdocs
docs.text:
Set up Material for Mkdocs to generate static pages and blog for the documentation project.

Install mkdocs: 

python3 -m pip install --user mkdocs

Create new site:

Create new project
mkdocs new blog3

INFO     -  Creating project directory: blog
INFO     -  Writing config file: blog/mkdocs.yml
INFO     -  Writing initial docs: blog/docs/index.md

Python3.6 was installed as default. Blog plugin in Material for Mkdocs requires verion 9.2.0 or above python3.7 or above. Installing latest version of Material for Mkdocs under python3.6 did not work.

Install Material for Mkdocs version 8.2.11 for python3.6

Source: https://github.com/squidfunk/mkdocs-material/issues/3866

Install Material for Mkdocs version 8.2.11 which is the last version compatible with python3.6. 

python3 -m pip install --user mkdocs-material==8.2.11

docs.title: Create virtual environment
docs.text:
Set up virtual environment to run mkdocs in python3.9.

Command: 

python<version> -m venv <virtual-environment-name>
cd blog
python3.9 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
(venv) [sbms@L459 blog]$ python3 -m pip install mkdocs-material mkdocs-encryptcontent-plugin

Mkdocs version 1.6.0 installed

docs.title: Set up a blog in Material for Mkdocs
docs.text:
Inforamtion from Material for Mkdocs:

  • Tutorial on blog in Material
  • Setting up a blog
  • Blog plugin

Steps:

  1. Edit blog/mkdocs.yml to turn on blog plugin: 
    site_name: My Docs
theme: 
  name: material
  features:
    # Setting up navigation
    # https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/setup/setting-up-navigation/
    - navigation.instant #instant loading
    - navigation.tabs
    - navigation.tabs.sticky
    - navigation.sections
    - navigation.indexes
    # - navigation.expand
    # - toc.integrate
    # https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/reference/code-blocks/
    - content.code.copy
  palette:
    primary: teal
nav:
  - 'Home': index.md
  - 'Q-and-A': 
    - Q-and-A/index.md # rename blog to Q-and-A
  - Tags: tags.md

markdown_extensions:
  # Extensions
  # https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/setup/extensions/
  - admonition
  - attr_list
  - md_in_html # allows for writing Markdown inside of HTML
  # Python Markdown Extensions
  # https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/setup/extensions/python-markdown-extensions/
  - pymdownx.caret
  - pymdownx.mark
  - pymdownx.tilde
  - pymdownx.critic
  - pymdownx.details # for Admonition
  - pymdownx.superfences
  - pymdownx.keys
  - pymdownx.tasklist
  - pymdownx.emoji:
      emoji_index: !!python/name:material.extensions.emoji.twemoji
      emoji_generator: !!python/name:material.extensions.emoji.to_svg

plugins:
    # Built-in plugins
    # https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/plugins/
    - search
    - encryptcontent:
        # global_password: 'xxxx'
        remember_password: True    
        # default_expire_delay: 24  # <-- Default expire delay in hours (optional)    
        # password_button: True
        # password_button_text: 'custom_text_button'
    # - enumerate-headings # produce numbered headings 
    - blog:
        blog_dir: Q-and-A # change folder name from blog to Q-and-A
        authors: True
        authors_file: "Q-and-A/.authors.yml"
        blog_toc: True
        post_date_format: full
        post_readtime: true
        post_readtime_words_per_minute: 265
        #categories_allowed: # define categories here
         # - Holidays
         # - python
    - tags:
        tags_file: tags.md
  2. Rename docs/blog to docs/Q-and-A
  3. Create docs/Q-and-A/image folder.
  4. Edit docs/Q-and-A/.author.yml 
    authors:
  bcwwong:
    name: Brian Wong
    description: ''
    # avatar: https://www.sbms.hku.hk/f/staff/120/239c243/brianWong-300.jpg
    avatar: Q-and-A/image/brianWong-300.jpg
    slug: http://www.hku.hk
    url: mailto:busywong@gmail.com
  5. Create file tags.md in docs/tags.md
  6. Create blog entries, following steps in https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/tutorials/blogs/basic/

mkdocs serve -a ip.address:8000 (for specific IP e.g. 192.168.1.146)

mkdocs serve (for localhost:8000)

docs.title: Deploying mkdocs pages to GitHub Pages
docs.text:
https://githowto.com/more_setup

  1. Set up account in github.com
    • username: bcwwong
  2. Create repository with the same name as username: bcwwong.github.io on GitHub. See https://pages.github.com/.
  3. Install Git on local computer.
  4. Create folder <username>.github.io under mkdocs project_folder (e.g. blog/bcwwong.github.io)
  5. cd to project_foler/<username>.github.io e.g blog/bcwwong.github.io.
  6. Initialize git: 
    git init 
git config user.email "busywong@gmail.com"
git config user.name "Brian Wong"
git remote add origin https://github.com/bcwwong/bcwwong.github.io.git
    From https://githowto.com/more_setup For Windows: 
    git config core.autocrlf true
git config core.safecrlf warn
    For Linux/Mac: 
    git config core.autocrlf input
git config core.safecrlf warn

  7. Build and deploy mkdocs pages to GitHub pages: 

    mkdocs gh-deploy --config-file ../mkdocs.yml --remote-branch main

    Warning

    May need to run git pull command first if deploying to the same GitHub page from different machines. 

    git pull
mkdocs gh-deploy --config-file ../mkdocs.yml --remote-branch main

  8. Pages are deployed to https://bcwwong.github.io/

    Install gh cli for Linux

    Need to login GitHub first. Follow instructions from https://docs.rockylinux.org/gemstones/git/00-gh_cli_installation/ to install gh cli.

    curl -fsSL https://cli.github.com/packages/rpm/gh-cli.repo | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/github-cli.repo
sudo dnf -y install gh
    Then run gh auth login and follow on-screen instructions.
